001package squidpony.squidgrid.gui.gdx;
002
003import com.badlogic.gdx.Application;
004import com.badlogic.gdx.Gdx;
005import com.badlogic.gdx.LifecycleListener;
006import com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.Texture;
007import com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.g2d.BitmapFont;
008import com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.g2d.DistanceFieldFont;
009import com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.g2d.TextureAtlas;
010import com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.g2d.TextureRegion;
011import com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.glutils.ShaderProgram;
012import squidpony.squidmath.StatefulRNG;
013
014/**
015 * Default BitmapFonts, a sample image, "stretchable" fonts and icons, and a central RNG for use with libGDX.
016 * All but one of the resources here need to be downloaded separately, to avoid bloating the size of the dependency jar
017 * with many fonts that a game probably won't use. You can download assets in a jar with a release of SquidLib, or
018 * individually from https://github.com/yellowstonegames/SquidLib/tree/master/assets . The assets you choose should go in the
019 * android/assets (core/assets if you don't have an Android project) subfolder of your game if you use the normal libGDX
020 * setup tool or SquidSetup, or the assets subfolder if you use czyzby's alternate setup tool,
021 * https://github.com/czyzby/gdx-setup . They should not be placed in subdirectories of assets, otherwise this won't be
022 * able to find them.
023 * <br>
024 * The fonts provided are mostly monospaced, with most looking rather similar (straight orthogonal lines and right-angle
025 * curves), but some that look... better than the rest. For monospaced fonts that could be used on a grid in SquidPanel
026 * or SquidLayers, it is recommended that you use a "stretchable" font (which use a signed distance field, or SDF,
027 * effect to stretch smoothly) or a "crisp" font (which use a multi-channel signed distance field, or MSDF, effect to
028 * stretch smoothly and remain sharp at very high zooms). For some usage you may want a TextFamily instead of a normal
029 * TextCellFactory or BitmapFont; these TextFamily fonts store regular, bold, italic, and bold-italic faces in one file,
030 * and {@link GDXMarkup} can produce text that will render in those faces. Some good choices for fonts here are
031 * Iosevka, which comes in a sans-serif version with {@link #getStretchableLeanFont()}, {@link #getCrispLeanFont()}, 
032 * {@link #getCrispLeanFamily()}, and more, as well as a slab-serif version with {@link #getStretchableSlabFont()},
033 * {@link #getCrispSlabFont()}, and {@link #getCrispSlabFamily()}, among others, as well as Inconsolata-LGC, which is
034 * more geometric sans-serif accessible with {@link #getStretchableFont()}, or (well-suited for square glyphs)
035 * {@link #getStretchableSquareFont()} (it does not have a crisp variety). Another is Computer Modern, accessible by
036 * {@link #getStretchableTypewriterFont()}, which has a chunky, ornamented style. For variable-width fonts
037 * that can be used in TextPanel, among others, you can use the recommended crisp font family Noto Serif
038 * with {@link #getCrispPrintFamily()}, or for stretchable fonts there's the serif font Gentium with
039 * {@link #getStretchablePrintFont()} or Noto Sans with {@link #getStretchableCleanFont()} (Noto Sans currently has
040 * problems that Noto Serif does not have). All of the fonts so far support the Latin, Greek, and Cyrillic alphabets.
041 * <br>
042 * If you can't decide, go with {@link #getCrispLeanFont()} or {@link #getCrispSlabFont()}, which return TextCellFactory
043 * objects, and call their .width(int), .height(int), and .initBySize() methods to make them the size (and aspect ratio)
044 * you want. You can use stretchable or crisp fonts with equal width and height to make
045 * a horizontally-stretched version of a square font instead of the existing square fonts that add blank space.
046 * <br>
047 * The most Latin script support for a monospaced font is in the font Mandrill, accessible by getDefaultUnicodeFont()
048 * and getLargeUnicodeFont() in two different sizes, and the latter should be suitable for everything from Spanish and
049 * French, to Polish to Vietnamese. You can use Gentium for even better language support with a variable-width font in
050 * TextPanel or the like; it is accessible with getStretchablePrintFont(). Google's Noto font also supports many glyphs
051 * in a variable-width format; it is accessible with getStretchableCleanFont() but may have some issues with baseline
052 * level changing and character-to-character alignment seeming too high or low.
053 * <br>
054 * The sample image is a tentacle taken from a public domain icon collection graciously released by Henrique Lazarini;
055 * it's fitting for SquidLib to have a tentacle as a logo or something, I guess?
056 * <br>
057 * The icons are from http://game-icons.net , there are over 2000 of them, and they're among the only images that should
058 * both be recolor-able easily (like chars in a font) and resize-able easily if you use a stretchable font at the same
059 * time. The stretchable font TextCellFactories do some work with shaders that makes most images look incorrect, but
060 * allow distance field fonts and these distance field icons to resize smoothly. Mixing stretchable fonts with
061 * non-stretchable images or fonts is not a great idea, and usually involves a slow shader change back and forth.
062 * <br>
063 * You can get a default RNG with getGuiRandom(); this should probably not be reused for non-GUI-related randomness,
064 * but is meant instead to be used wherever randomized purely-aesthetic effects are needed, such as a jiggling effect.
065 * Created by Tommy Ettinger on 7/11/2015.
066 */
067public class DefaultResources implements LifecycleListener {

153    public static final String vertexShader = "attribute vec4 " + ShaderProgram.POSITION_ATTRIBUTE + ";\n"
154            + "attribute vec4 " + ShaderProgram.COLOR_ATTRIBUTE + ";\n"
155            + "attribute vec2 " + ShaderProgram.TEXCOORD_ATTRIBUTE + "0;\n"
156            + "uniform mat4 u_projTrans;\n"
157            + "varying vec4 v_color;\n"
158            + "varying vec2 v_texCoords;\n"
159            + "\n"
160            + "void main() {\n"
161            + " v_color = " + ShaderProgram.COLOR_ATTRIBUTE + ";\n"
162            + " v_color.a = v_color.a * (255.0/254.0);\n"
163            + " v_texCoords = " + ShaderProgram.TEXCOORD_ATTRIBUTE + "0;\n"
164            + " gl_Position =  u_projTrans * " + ShaderProgram.POSITION_ATTRIBUTE + ";\n"
165            + "}\n";

167    public static final String fragmentShader =
168            "#ifdef GL_ES\n" //
169                    + " precision mediump float;\n" //
170                    + " precision mediump int;\n" //
171                    + "#endif\n" //
172                    + "\n" //
173                    + "uniform sampler2D u_texture;\n" //
174                    + "uniform float u_smoothing;\n" //
175                    + "varying vec4 v_color;\n" //
176                    + "varying vec2 v_texCoords;\n" //
177                    + "\n" //
178                    + "void main() {\n" //
179                    + " if (u_smoothing > 0.0) {\n" //
180                    + "         float smoothing = u_smoothing;\n" //
181                    + "         float distance = texture2D(u_texture, v_texCoords).a;\n" //
182                    + "         float alpha = smoothstep(0.5 - smoothing, 0.5 + smoothing, distance);\n" //
183                    + "         gl_FragColor = vec4(v_color.rgb, alpha * v_color.a);\n" //
184                    + " } else {\n" //
185                    + "         gl_FragColor = v_color * texture2D(u_texture, v_texCoords);\n" //
186                    + " }\n" //
187                    + "}\n";

233    public static final String msdfFragmentShader =  "#ifdef GL_ES\n"
234            + " precision mediump float;\n"
235            + " precision mediump int;\n"
236            + "#endif\n"
237            + "\n"
238            + "uniform sampler2D u_texture;\n"
239            + "uniform float u_smoothing;\n"
240            + "varying vec4 v_color;\n"
241            + "varying vec2 v_texCoords;\n"
242            + "\n"
243            + "void main() {\n"
244            + "  vec3 sdf = texture2D(u_texture, v_texCoords).rgb;\n"
245            + "  gl_FragColor = vec4(v_color.rgb, clamp((max(min(sdf.r, sdf.g), min(max(sdf.r, sdf.g), sdf.b)) - 0.5) * u_smoothing + 0.5, 0.0, 1.0) * v_color.a);\n"
246            + "}\n";
247            //+ " float dist = (max(min(sdf.r, sdf.g), min(max(sdf.r, sdf.g), sdf.b)) - 0.5) / (2.75 * u_smoothing);\n"
248            //+ " float d = u_smoothing * 1.75;\n" 
249            //+ " float d = fwidth(dist);\n"
250            //+ " float alpha = clamp(dist + 0.5, 0.0, 1.0);\n"
251            //+ " float alpha = smoothstep(-d, d, dist);\n"
252            //+ " if(alpha == 0) { discard; }\n"
253            //+ "       gl_FragColor = vec4(v_color.rgb, alpha * v_color.a);\n"
254
255            //+ "        vec3 sdf;\n"
256            //+ "        vec4 box = vec4(v_texCoords-0.0000625, v_texCoords+0.0000625);\n"
257            //+ "  sdf = texture2D(u_texture, box.xy).rgb;\n"
258            //+ "        float asum = clamp((max(min(sdf.r, sdf.g), min(max(sdf.r, sdf.g), sdf.b)) - 0.5) / (6.0 * u_smoothing) + 0.5, 0.0, 0.5);\n"
259            //+ "  sdf = texture2D(u_texture, box.zw).rgb;\n"
260            //+ "  asum = asum + clamp((max(min(sdf.r, sdf.g), min(max(sdf.r, sdf.g), sdf.b)) - 0.5) / (6.0 * u_smoothing) + 0.5, 0.0, 0.5); +\n"
261            //+ "  sdf = texture2D(u_texture, box.xw).rgb;\n"
262            //+ "  asum = asum + clamp((max(min(sdf.r, sdf.g), min(max(sdf.r, sdf.g), sdf.b)) - 0.5) / (6.0 * u_smoothing) + 0.5, 0.0, 0.5); +\n"
263            //+ "  sdf = texture2D(u_texture, box.zy).rgb;\n"
264            //+ "  asum = asum + clamp((max(min(sdf.r, sdf.g), min(max(sdf.r, sdf.g), sdf.b)) - 0.5) / (6.0 * u_smoothing) + 0.5, 0.0, 0.5); +\n"
265            //+ "  sdf = texture2D(u_texture, v_texCoords).rgb;\n"
266            //+ "  gl_FragColor = vec4(v_color.rgb, clamp(((max(min(sdf.r, sdf.g), min(max(sdf.r, sdf.g), sdf.b)) - 0.625) / (3.0 * u_smoothing) + 0.625 + asum) / 3.0, 0.0, 1.0) * v_color.a);\n"
267            //+ "}\n";
268    /**
269     * An alternate shader based on {@link DefaultResources#fragmentShader}, but this draws outlines around characters.
270     * Only works with distance field fonts. You probably need to create a new ShaderProgram to use this, which would
271     * look like {@code new ShaderProgram(DefaultResources.vertexShader, DefaultResources.outlineFragmentShader)}, and
272     * would assign this to your TextCellFactory's {@link TextCellFactory#shader} field after the TextCellFactory is
273     * fully initialized (calling {@link TextCellFactory#initBySize()}) will set the shader back to the default).
274     */
275    public static final String outlineFragmentShader = "#ifdef GL_ES\n"
276            + "precision mediump float;\n"
277            + "precision mediump int;\n"
278            + "#endif\n"
279            + "\n"
280            + "uniform sampler2D u_texture;\n"
281            + "uniform float u_smoothing;\n"
282            + "varying vec4 v_color;\n"
283            + "varying vec2 v_texCoords;\n"
284            + "\n"
285            + "void main() {\n"
286            + "  if(u_smoothing <= 0.0) {\n"
287            + "    float smoothing = -u_smoothing;\n"
288            + "    vec4 box = vec4(v_texCoords-0.000125, v_texCoords+0.000125);\n"
289            + "    vec2 sample0 = texture2D(u_texture, v_texCoords).ra;\n"
290            + "    vec2 sample1 = texture2D(u_texture, box.xy).ra;\n"
291            + "    vec2 sample2 = texture2D(u_texture, box.zw).ra;\n"
292            + "    vec2 sample3 = texture2D(u_texture, box.xw).ra;\n"
293            + "    vec2 sample4 = texture2D(u_texture, box.zy).ra;\n"
294            + "    float asum = smoothstep(0.5 - smoothing, 0.5 + smoothing, min(sample0.x, sample0.y)) + 0.5 * (\n"
295            + "                 smoothstep(0.5 - smoothing, 0.5 + smoothing, min(sample1.x, sample1.y)) +\n"
296            + "                 smoothstep(0.5 - smoothing, 0.5 + smoothing, min(sample2.x, sample2.y)) +\n"
297            + "                 smoothstep(0.5 - smoothing, 0.5 + smoothing, min(sample3.x, sample3.y)) +\n"
298            + "                 smoothstep(0.5 - smoothing, 0.5 + smoothing, min(sample4.x, sample4.y)));\n"
299            + "    gl_FragColor = vec4(v_color.rgb, (asum / 3.0) * v_color.a);\n"
300            + "  } else {\n"
301            + "    vec2 radistance = texture2D(u_texture, v_texCoords).ra;\n"
302            + "    float distance = min(radistance.x, radistance.y);\n"
303//            + "          vec2 box = vec2(0.0, 0.00375 * (u_smoothing + 0.0825));\n"
304//            + "          float asum = 0.7 * (smoothstep(0.5 - u_smoothing, 0.5 + u_smoothing, distance) + \n"
305//            + "                   smoothstep(0.5 - u_smoothing, 0.5 + u_smoothing, texture2D(u_texture, v_texCoords + box.xy).a) +\n"
306//            + "                   smoothstep(0.5 - u_smoothing, 0.5 + u_smoothing, texture2D(u_texture, v_texCoords - box.xy).a) +\n"
307//            + "                   smoothstep(0.5 - u_smoothing, 0.5 + u_smoothing, texture2D(u_texture, v_texCoords + box.yx).a) +\n"
308//            + "                   smoothstep(0.5 - u_smoothing, 0.5 + u_smoothing, texture2D(u_texture, v_texCoords - box.yx).a)),\n"
309            + "    vec4 box = vec4(v_texCoords-0.000625, v_texCoords+0.000625);\n"
310            + "    vec2 sample0 = texture2D(u_texture, v_texCoords).ra;\n"
311            + "    vec2 sample1 = texture2D(u_texture, box.xy).ra;\n"
312            + "    vec2 sample2 = texture2D(u_texture, box.zw).ra;\n"
313            + "    vec2 sample3 = texture2D(u_texture, box.xw).ra;\n"
314            + "    vec2 sample4 = texture2D(u_texture, box.zy).ra;\n"
315            + "    float asum = smoothstep(0.5 - u_smoothing, 0.5 + u_smoothing, min(sample0.x, sample0.y)) + 0.5 * (\n"
316            + "                 smoothstep(0.5 - u_smoothing, 0.5 + u_smoothing, min(sample1.x, sample1.y)) +\n"
317            + "                 smoothstep(0.5 - u_smoothing, 0.5 + u_smoothing, min(sample2.x, sample2.y)) +\n"
318            + "                 smoothstep(0.5 - u_smoothing, 0.5 + u_smoothing, min(sample3.x, sample3.y)) +\n"
319            + "                 smoothstep(0.5 - u_smoothing, 0.5 + u_smoothing, min(sample4.x, sample4.y))),\n"
320//            + "                 char = step(distance, 0.35);\n"
321            + "                 fancy = step(0.55, distance);\n"
322//            + "                 outline = clamp((distance * 0.8 - 0.415) * 18.0, 0.0, 1.0);\n"
323            + "    gl_FragColor = vec4(v_color.rgb * fancy, (asum + step(0.3, distance)) * v_color.a);\n"
324            + "  }\n"
325            + "}\n";
326    /**
327     * An alternate shader based on {@link DefaultResources#msdfFragmentShader}, but this draws outlines around
328     * characters. This should be sharper than {@link #outlineFragmentShader},  but only works with MSDF (crisp) fonts.
329     * Unlike that shader, this doesn't have special behavior for negative
330     * {@link TextCellFactory#getSmoothingMultiplier()} values, though that may be added later.
331     * You probably need to create a new ShaderProgram to use this, which would look like
332     * {@code new ShaderProgram(DefaultResources.vertexShader, DefaultResources.msdfOutlineFragmentShader)}, and
333     * would assign this to your TextCellFactory's {@link TextCellFactory#shader} field after the TextCellFactory is
334     * fully initialized (calling {@link TextCellFactory#initBySize()}) will set the shader back to the default).
335     */
336    public static final String msdfOutlineFragmentShader =  "#ifdef GL_ES\n"
337            + " precision mediump float;\n"
338            + " precision mediump int;\n"
339            + "#endif\n"
340            + "\n"
341            + "uniform sampler2D u_texture;\n"
342            + "uniform float u_smoothing;\n"
343            + "varying vec4 v_color;\n"
344            + "varying vec2 v_texCoords;\n"
345            + "\n"
346            + "void main() {\n"
347            + "  vec3 sdf = texture2D(u_texture, v_texCoords).rgb;\n"
348//            + "  float distance = (max(min(sdf.r, sdf.g), min(max(sdf.r, sdf.g), sdf.b)) - 0.425);\n"
349//            + "  gl_FragColor = vec4(step(3.5 * u_smoothing, distance * 0.75) * v_color.rgb, clamp((distance / (3.4 * u_smoothing)) + 0.9125, 0.0, 1.0) * v_color.a);\n"
350
351            //+ "  float cd = clamp(distance, 0.0, 1.0);"
352
353            + "  float d = ((max(min(sdf.r, sdf.g), min(max(sdf.r, sdf.g), sdf.b))) - 0.4);\n"
354            + "  float block = step(-0.4999999, d);\n"
355            + "  float nice = step(0.24999999, d);\n"
356            + "  gl_FragColor = vec4(v_color.rgb * nice, clamp(d * u_smoothing + (block + 1.0) * 0.5, 0.0, 1.0) * v_color.a);\n"
357            + "}\n";
358
359    private SquidColorCenter scc;
360    private Texture tentacle;
361    private TextureRegion tentacleRegion;
362    private StatefulRNG guiRandom;
363
364    private static DefaultResources instance;
365
366    static BitmapFont copyFont(BitmapFont font)
367    {
368        if(font == null) return new BitmapFont();
369        return new BitmapFont(new BitmapFont.BitmapFontData(font.getData().getFontFile(), false),
370                font.getRegions(), font.usesIntegerPositions());
371    }
372    private DefaultResources()
373    {
374        if(Gdx.app == null)
375            throw new IllegalStateException("Gdx.app cannot be null; initialize GUI-using objects in create() or later.");
376        Gdx.app.addLifecycleListener(this);
377    }
378
379    private static void initialize()
380    {
381        if(instance == null)
382            instance = new DefaultResources();
383    }
384
385    /**
386     * Gets the one font guaranteed to be included in libGDX, which is Arial at size 15 px.
387     * @return the BitmapFont representing Arial.ttf at size 15 px
388     */
389    public static BitmapFont getIncludedFont()
390    {
391        initialize();
392        if(instance.arial15 == null)
393        {
394            try {
395                instance.arial15 = new BitmapFont();
396                //instance.narrow1.getData().padBottom = instance.narrow1.getDescent();
397            } catch (Exception ignored) {
398            }
399        }
400        return copyFont(instance.arial15);
401    }
402    /**
403     * Returns a 12x12px, stretched but curvaceous font as an embedded resource. Caches it for later calls.
404     * <br>
405     * Needs files:
406     * <ul>
407     *     <li>https://github.com/yellowstonegames/SquidLib/blob/master/assets/Zodiac-Square-12x12.fnt</li>
408     *     <li>https://github.com/yellowstonegames/SquidLib/blob/master/assets/Zodiac-Square-12x12.png</li>
409     * </ul>
410     * @return the BitmapFont object representing Zodiac-Square.ttf at size 16 pt
411     */
412    public static BitmapFont getDefaultFont()
413    {
414        initialize();
415        if(instance.square1 == null)
416        {
417            try {
418                instance.square1 = new BitmapFont(Gdx.files.internal(squareName), Gdx.files.internal(squareTexture), false);
419                //instance.square1.getData().padBottom = instance.square1.getDescent();
420            } catch (Exception ignored) {
421            }
422        }
423        return copyFont(instance.square1);
424    }

519    /**
520     * Returns a 8x18px, very smooth and generally good-looking font (based on Inconsolata) as an embedded resource.
521     * This font fully supports Latin, Greek, Cyrillic, and of particular interest to SquidLib, Box Drawing characters.
522     * Caches the font for later calls. You may prefer {@link #getCrispSmoothFont()}, which is the same font but should
523     * scale to more sizes and aspect ratios very smoothly.
524     * <br>
525     * Needs files:
526     * <ul>
527     *     <li>https://github.com/yellowstonegames/SquidLib/blob/master/assets/Inconsolata-LGC-8x18.fnt</li>
528     *     <li>https://github.com/yellowstonegames/SquidLib/blob/master/assets/Inconsolata-LGC-8x18.png</li>
529     * </ul>
530     * @return the BitmapFont object representing Inconsolata-LGC.ttf at size... pretty sure it's 8x18 pixels
531     */
532    public static BitmapFont getSmoothFont()
533    {
534        initialize();
535        if(instance.smooth1 == null)
536        {
537            try {
538                instance.smooth1 = new BitmapFont(Gdx.files.internal(smoothName), Gdx.files.internal(smoothTexture), false);
539                //instance.smooth1.getData().padBottom = instance.smooth1.getDescent();
540            } catch (Exception ignored) {
541            }
542        }
543        return copyFont(instance.smooth1);
544    }

618    /**
619     * Returns a 25x25px, very smooth and generally good-looking font (based on Inconsolata) as an embedded resource.
620     * This font fully supports Latin, Greek, Cyrillic, and of particular interest to SquidLib, Box Drawing characters.
621     * This variant is (almost) perfectly square, and box drawing characters should line up at size 25x25 px, but other
622     * glyphs will have much more horizontal spacing than in other fonts. Caches the font for later calls. You may want
623     * {@link #getStretchableSquareFont()} instead, which is the same font but can stretch smoothly to most sizes.
624     * <br>
625     * Needs files:
626     * <ul>
627     *     <li>https://github.com/yellowstonegames/SquidLib/blob/master/assets/Inconsolata-LGC-Square-25x25.fnt</li>
628     *     <li>https://github.com/yellowstonegames/SquidLib/blob/master/assets/Inconsolata-LGC-Square-25x25.png</li>
629     * </ul>
630     * @return the BitmapFont object representing Inconsolata-LGC-Square at size 25x25 pixels
631     */
632    public static BitmapFont getSquareSmoothFont()
633    {
634        initialize();

639                //instance.smoothSquare.getData().padBottom = instance.smoothSquare.getDescent();
640            } catch (Exception ignored) {
641            }
642        }
643        return copyFont(instance.smoothSquare);
644    }

650     * license file linked below.

657     * </ul>

673    /**
674     * Returns a 8x20px, extremely thin font (that may be barely legible) as an embedded resource.

676     * A smaller version of this font, {@link #getTinyFont()}, has the lowest width of any font asset distributed with
677     * SquidLib; this doubles its resolution in case you like its appearance but don't want to go blind. Caches the font
678     * for later calls. Attribution to Christian Munk (or the username he used, CMunk) is required to use this font;
679     * this is in the license file linked below.
680     * <br>
681     * Needs files:
682     * <ul>
683     *     <li>https://github.com/yellowstonegames/SquidLib/blob/master/assets/Monty-8x20.fnt</li>
684     *     <li>https://github.com/yellowstonegames/SquidLib/blob/master/assets/Monty-8x20.png</li>

686     * </ul>

688     */

696            } catch (Exception ignored) {

701    /**
702     * Returns a 7x12px font with identical (excellent) Unicode coverage to Iosevka, as an embedded resource.
703     * The font is 7-12-serif by Christian Munk, but not all of the Unicode glyphs supported in his amazingly-huge font
704     * are present here; just the subset that's compatible with Iosevka (which is way more than is required for SquidLib
705     * to present most things). Caches the font for later calls, but be aware that if you copy the BitmapFont instead of
706     * calling this method again, it won't stay monospaced because of a quirk of libGDX. Attribution to Christian Munk
707     * (or the username he used, CMunk) is required to use this font; this is in the license file linked below.
708     * <br>
709     * Needs files:
710     * <ul>
711     *     <li>https://github.com/yellowstonegames/SquidLib/blob/master/assets/7-12-serif.fnt</li>
712     *     <li>https://github.com/yellowstonegames/SquidLib/blob/master/assets/7-12-serif.png</li>
713     *     <li>https://github.com/yellowstonegames/SquidLib/blob/master/assets/7-12-serif-license.txt</li>
714     *     <li>https://github.com/yellowstonegames/SquidLib/blob/master/assets/7-12-serif-readme.txt</li>
715     * </ul>
716     * @return the BitmapFont object representing 7-12-serif.ttf at a size that gives exactly 7 px wide by 12 px tall
717     */
718    public static BitmapFont getSevenTwelveFont()
719    {
720        initialize();
721        if(instance.sevenTwelve == null)
722        {
723            try {
724                instance.sevenTwelve = new BitmapFont(Gdx.files.internal(sevenTwelveName), Gdx.files.internal(sevenTwelveTexture), false);
725            } catch (Exception ignored) {
726            }
727        }
728        final BitmapFont cpy = copyFont(instance.sevenTwelve);
729        TextCellFactory.setAllFixedWidth(cpy);
730        return cpy;
731    }
732    /**
733     * Returns a 14x27px font with fairly good Unicode coverage and an octagonal, angular look, as an embedded resource.
734     * The font is Computer Says No by Christian Munk, which has a nice clean appearance. Caches the font for later
735     * calls, but be aware that if you copy the BitmapFont instead of calling this method again, it won't stay
736     * monospaced because of a quirk of libGDX. Attribution to Christian Munk (or the username he used,
737     * CMunk) is required to use this font; this is in the license file linked below.
738     * <br>
739     * Needs files:
740     * <ul>
741     *     <li>https://github.com/yellowstonegames/SquidLib/blob/master/assets/ComputerSaysNo.fnt</li>
742     *     <li>https://github.com/yellowstonegames/SquidLib/blob/master/assets/ComputerSaysNo.png</li>
743     *     <li>https://github.com/yellowstonegames/SquidLib/blob/master/assets/ComputerSaysNo-license.txt</li>
744     *     <li>https://github.com/yellowstonegames/SquidLib/blob/master/assets/ComputerSaysNo-readme.txt</li>
745     * </ul>
746     * @return the BitmapFont object representing ComputerSaysNo.ttf at a size that gives about 14 px wide by 27 px tall
747     */
748    public static BitmapFont getOctagonalMonoFont()
749    {
750        initialize();
751        if(instance.computerSaysNo == null)
752        {
753            try {
754                instance.computerSaysNo = new BitmapFont(Gdx.files.internal(computerSaysNoName), Gdx.files.internal(computerSaysNoTexture), false);
755            } catch (Exception e) {
756                instance.computerSaysNo = new BitmapFont();
757            }
758        }
759        final BitmapFont cpy = copyFont(instance.computerSaysNo);
760        TextCellFactory.setAllFixedWidth(cpy);
761        return cpy;
762    }

767     * calls. Attribution is not required; Cozette is MIT-licensed, and we aren't distributing any of its files. Still,
768     * credit goes to slavfox for this nice, highly-usable font.

771     * <ul>

792    /**
793     * Returns a 7x14px pixel font with broad coverage of Unicode, including Greek, Cyrillic, Braille, and tech-related
794     * icons, with a black outline applied around the white inner strokes. The outline typically won't be colored when
795     * the rest of the font is, but the inner stroke changes color normally. The font is
796     * <a href="https://github.com/slavfox/Cozette">Cozette by slavfox</a>. Caches the font for later
797     * calls. Attribution is not required; Cozette is MIT-licensed, and we aren't distributing any of its files. Still,
798     * credit goes to slavfox for this nice, highly-usable font.
799     * <br>
800     * Using this font in a TextCellFactory is experimental; it should be usable in scene2d.ui widgets, though.
801     * <br>
802     * Needs files:
803     * <ul>
804     *     <li>https://github.com/yellowstonegames/SquidLib/blob/master/assets/CozetteOutlined.fnt</li>
805     *     <li>https://github.com/yellowstonegames/SquidLib/blob/master/assets/CozetteOutlined.png</li>
806     * </ul>
807     * @return the BitmapFont object representing CozetteVector.ttf at size 12 pt with a square outline applied
808     */
809    public static BitmapFont getCozyOutlinedFont()
810    {
811        initialize();
812        if(instance.cozetteOutlined == null)
813        {
814            try {
815                instance.cozetteOutlined = new BitmapFont(Gdx.files.internal(cozetteOutlinedName), Gdx.files.internal(cozetteOutlinedTexture), false);
816            } catch (Exception ignored) {
817            }
818        }
819        BitmapFont cpy = copyFont(instance.cozetteOutlined);
820        TextCellFactory.setAllFixedWidth(cpy);
821        return cpy;
822    }
823
824    /**
825     * Returns a TextCellFactory already configured to use a square font that should scale cleanly to many sizes. This
826     * font is Inconsolata-LGC with the weight adjusted and some glyphs added from DejaVu Sans Mono. It supports a good
827     * range of Latin glyphs (not enough for Vietnamese, but enough for Western European languages), as well as the
828     * Greek and Cyrillic alphabets, box drawing characters, and some dingbats. Caches the result for later calls.
829     * <br>
830     * Preview: http://i.imgur.com/DD1RkPa.png
831     * <br>
832     * This creates a TextCellFactory instead of a BitmapFont because it needs to set some extra information so the
833     * distance field font technique this uses can work.
834     * <br>
835     * Needs files:
836     * <ul>
837     *     <li>https://github.com/yellowstonegames/SquidLib/blob/master/assets/Inconsolata-LGC-Square-distance.fnt</li>
838     *     <li>https://github.com/yellowstonegames/SquidLib/blob/master/assets/Inconsolata-LGC-Square-distance.png</li>
839     * </ul>
840     * @return the TextCellFactory object that can represent many sizes of the square font Inconsolata-LGC-Square.ttf
841     */
842    public static TextCellFactory getStretchableSquareFont()
843    {
844        initialize();
845        if(instance.distanceSquare == null)
846        {
847            try {
848                instance.distanceSquare = new TextCellFactory().defaultDistanceFieldFont();
849            } catch (Exception ignored) {
850            }
851        }
852        if(instance.distanceSquare != null)
853            return instance.distanceSquare.copy();
854        return null;
855    }

857    /**
858     * Returns a TextCellFactory already configured to use an blocky, fairly-bold square font that should scale cleanly
859     * to many sizes. Unlike {@link #getStretchableSquareFont()}, the font this uses was made to be square initially,
860     * and is not a distorted/stretched version of an existing font. Caches the result for later calls.
861     * <br>
862     * Note: Uses a smoothing multiplier of 2.125f, instead of the default 1.2f. 
863     * <br>
864     * <a href="https://i.imgur.com/nIjgTOp.png">Preview at 6x6 size, https://i.imgur.com/nIjgTOp.png</a>
865     * <a href="https://i.imgur.com/lWaSgVN.png">Preview at much larger size, https://i.imgur.com/lWaSgVN.png</a>
866     * <br>
867     * This creates a TextCellFactory instead of a BitmapFont because it needs to set some extra information so the
868     * distance field font technique this uses can work.
869     * <br>
870     * Needs files:
871     * <ul>
872     *     <li>https://github.com/yellowstonegames/SquidLib/blob/master/assets/BoxedIn-distance.fnt</li>
873     *     <li>https://github.com/yellowstonegames/SquidLib/blob/master/assets/BoxedIn-distance.png</li>
874     * </ul>
875     * @return the TextCellFactory object that can represent many sizes of the square font BoxedIn.ttf
876     */
877    public static TextCellFactory getStretchableHeavySquareFont()
878    {
879        initialize();
880        if(instance.distanceHeavySquare == null)
881        {
882            try {
883                instance.distanceHeavySquare = new TextCellFactory()
884                        .fontDistanceField(distanceFieldHeavySquare, distanceFieldHeavySquareTexture)
885                        .setSmoothingMultiplier(2.50f);
886            } catch (Exception ignored) {
887            }
888        }
889        if(instance.distanceHeavySquare != null)
890            return instance.distanceHeavySquare.copy();
891        return null;
892    }

894    /**
895     * Returns a TextCellFactory already configured to use an all-caps (with lighter-weight versions of upper-case
896     * letters for the lower-case glyphs) square font that should scale cleanly to many sizes.
897     * Unlike {@link #getStretchableSquareFont()}, the font this uses was made to be square initially, and is not a
898     * distorted/stretched version of an existing font. This font only supports ASCII, and as said before, it doesn't
899     * have separate lower-case letters. Note: if you use this font as-is, most characters will overlap slightly with
900     * each other, which can be an aesthetic benefit in some styles but can also be hard to read, at least if the colors
901     * aren't different between overlapping characters. For that reason, you may want to tweak the width and height of
902     * this font after passing it to a SquidLayers or SparseLayers; often you would pass 0.875 times the original
903     * width and height to {@link TextCellFactory#tweakWidth(float)} and {@link TextCellFactory#tweakHeight(float)}.
904     * Caches the result for later calls. The font is "square" by Wouter van Oortmerssen; it is available under a
905     * CC-BY-3.0 license, which requires attribution to Wouter van Oortmerssen if you use it.
906     * <br>
907     * Note: Uses a smoothing multiplier of 6f, instead of the default 1.2f. 
908     * <br>
909     * <a href="https://i.imgur.com/nvHl64v.png">Preview at large size</a>
910     * <br>
911     * This creates a TextCellFactory instead of a BitmapFont because it needs to set some extra information so the
912     * distance field font technique this uses can work.
913     * <br>
914     * Needs files:
915     * <ul>
916     *     <li>https://github.com/yellowstonegames/SquidLib/blob/master/assets/square-msdf.fnt</li>
917     *     <li>https://github.com/yellowstonegames/SquidLib/blob/master/assets/square-msdf.png</li>
918     *     <li>https://github.com/yellowstonegames/SquidLib/blob/master/assets/square-License.txt</li>
919     * </ul>
920     * @return the TextCellFactory object that can represent many sizes of the font square.ttf
921     */
922    public static TextCellFactory getCrispCurvySquareFont()
923    {
924        initialize();
925        if(instance.msdfCurvySquare == null)
926        {
927            try {
928                instance.msdfCurvySquare = new TextCellFactory()
929                        .fontMultiDistanceField(crispCurvySquare, crispCurvySquareTexture).setSmoothingMultiplier(6f);
930            } catch (Exception ignored) {
931            }
932        }
933        if(instance.msdfCurvySquare != null)
934            return instance.msdfCurvySquare.copy();
935        return null;
936    }
937
938    /**
939     * Returns a TextCellFactory already configured to use a square font with 45-degree angled sections, based on the
940     * typeface used on the Atari ST console, that should scale cleanly to many sizes. Unlike
941     * {@link #getStretchableSquareFont()}, the font this uses was made to be square initially, and is not a
942     * distorted/stretched version of an existing font. This font only supports ASCII, but it supports all of it, unlike
943     * {@link #getCrispCurvySquareFont()}. Caches the result for later calls. The font is "a-starry", based on "Atari ST
944     * (low-res)" by Damien Guard; it is available under a CC-BY-SA-3.0 license, which requires attribution to Damien
945     * Guard (and technically Tommy Ettinger, because he made changes in a-starry) if you use it.
946     * <br>
947     * Note: Uses a smoothing multiplier of 3f, instead of the default 1.2f. 
948     * <br>
949     * <a href="https://i.imgur.com/nvHl64v.png">Preview at large size</a>
950     * <br>
951     * This creates a TextCellFactory instead of a BitmapFont because it needs to set some extra information so the
952     * distance field font technique this uses can work.
953     * <br>
954     * Needs files:
955     * <ul>
956     *     <li>https://github.com/yellowstonegames/SquidLib/blob/master/assets/a-starry-msdf.fnt</li>
957     *     <li>https://github.com/yellowstonegames/SquidLib/blob/master/assets/a-starry-msdf.png</li>
958     *     <li>https://github.com/yellowstonegames/SquidLib/blob/master/assets/a-starry-license.txt</li>
959     * </ul>
960     * @return the TextCellFactory object that can represent many sizes of the font a-starry.ttf
961     */
962    public static TextCellFactory getCrispOctagonalSquareFont()
963    {
964        initialize();
965        if(instance.msdfOctagonalSquare == null)
966        {
967            try {
968                instance.msdfOctagonalSquare = new TextCellFactory()
969                        .fontMultiDistanceField(crispOctagonalSquare, crispOctagonalSquareTexture).setSmoothingMultiplier(3f);
970            } catch (Exception ignored) {
971            }
972        }
973        if(instance.msdfOctagonalSquare != null)
974            return instance.msdfOctagonalSquare.copy();
975        return null;
976    }

979    /**
980     * Returns a TextCellFactory already configured to use a narrow font (twice as tall as it is wide) that should scale
981     * cleanly to many sizes. This font is Inconsolata-LGC with the weight adjusted and some glyphs added from DejaVu
982     * Sans Mono. It supports a good range of Latin glyphs (not enough for Vietnamese, but enough for Western European
983     * languages), as well as the Greek and Cyrillic alphabets, box drawing characters, and some dingbats. Caches the
984     * result for later calls.
985     * <br>
986     * Preview: http://i.imgur.com/dvEEMqo.png
987     * <br>
988     * This creates a TextCellFactory instead of a BitmapFont because it needs to set some extra information so the
989     * distance field font technique this uses can work.
990     * <br>
991     * Needs files:
992     * <ul>
993     *     <li>https://github.com/yellowstonegames/SquidLib/blob/master/assets/Inconsolata-LGC-Custom-distance.fnt</li>
994     *     <li>https://github.com/yellowstonegames/SquidLib/blob/master/assets/Inconsolata-LGC-Custom-distance.png</li>
995     * </ul>
996     * @return the TextCellFactory object that can represent many sizes of the font Inconsolata-LGC-Custom.ttf
997     */
998    public static TextCellFactory getStretchableFont()
999    {
1000        initialize();
1001        if(instance.distanceNarrow == null)
1002        {
1003            try {
1004                instance.distanceNarrow = new TextCellFactory().defaultNarrowDistanceFieldFont();
1005            } catch (Exception e) {
1006                e.printStackTrace();
1007            }
1008        }
1009        if(instance.distanceNarrow != null)
1010            return instance.distanceNarrow.copy();
1011        return null;
1012
1013    }

1047    /**
1048     * Returns a TextCellFactory already configured to use a highly-legible fixed-width font with broad Unicode support
1049     * that should scale cleanly to many sizes. Caches the result for later calls. The font used is Source Code Pro, an
1050     * open-source (SIL Open Font License) typeface by Adobe, and it has good Unicode support among the fixed-width
1051     * fonts used by SquidLib. It may be a good choice for science-fiction games because of its modern feel, but the
1052     * legibility enhancements made so the font could be usable in text editors also are nice for all text-based games.
1053     * The high glyph count means the part of the image for each glyph is smaller, though, so this may look slightly
1054     * pixelated if it starts small and is resized to much larger. A cell width of 15 and cell height of 27 is ideal;
1055     * this allows the font to resize fairly well to larger sizes using Viewports.
1056     * <br>
1057     * Preview: http://i.imgur.com/VC0xn2r.png
1058     * <br>
1059     * This creates a TextCellFactory instead of a BitmapFont because it needs to set some extra information so the
1060     * distance field font technique this uses can work.
1061     * <br>
1062     * Needs files:
1063     * <ul>
1064     *     <li>https://github.com/yellowstonegames/SquidLib/blob/master/assets/SourceCodePro-Medium-distance.fnt</li>
1065     *     <li>https://github.com/yellowstonegames/SquidLib/blob/master/assets/SourceCodePro-Medium-distance.png</li>
1066     * </ul>
1067     * @return the TextCellFactory object that can represent many sizes of the font SourceCodePro-Medium.otf
1068     */
1069    public static TextCellFactory getStretchableCodeFont()
1070    {
1071        initialize();
1072        if(instance.distanceCode == null)
1073        {
1074            try {
1075                instance.distanceCode = new TextCellFactory()
1076                        .fontDistanceField(distanceFieldCode, distanceFieldCodeTexture).setSmoothingMultiplier(3.50f);
1077            } catch (Exception e) {
1078                e.printStackTrace();
1079            }
1080        }
1081        if(instance.distanceCode != null)
1082            return instance.distanceCode.copy();
1083        return null;
1084    }
1085    /**
1086     * Returns a TextCellFactory already configured to use a highly-legible fixed-width font with strong CJK support (in
1087     * particular, very good coverage for Japanese) that should scale cleanly to many sizes. Caches the result for later
1088     * calls. The font used is Source Han Code JP, an open-source (SIL Open Font License) typeface by Adobe, and it has
1089     * the best CJK char support among the fonts used by SquidLib. It is extremely wide if used only for English text,
1090     * which may be desirable to make square cells. The very high glyph count means the part of the image for each glyph
1091     * is smaller, though, so this may look slightly pixelated if it starts small and is resized to much larger. A cell
1092     * width of 19 and cell height of 20 is ideal; this allows the font to resize fairly well to larger sizes.
1093     * <br>
1094     * Note: Uses a smoothing multiplier of 1.125f, instead of the default 1.2f. 
1095     * <br>
1096     * Preview: https://i.imgur.com/g65jXxB.png
1097     * <br>
1098     * This creates a TextCellFactory instead of a BitmapFont because it needs to set some extra information so the
1099     * distance field font technique this uses can work.
1100     * <br>
1101     * Needs files:
1102     * <ul>
1103     *     <li>https://github.com/yellowstonegames/SquidLib/blob/master/assets/SourceHanCodeJP-Regular-distance.fnt</li>
1104     *     <li>https://github.com/yellowstonegames/SquidLib/blob/master/assets/SourceHanCodeJP-Regular-distance.png</li>
1105     * </ul>
1106     * @return the TextCellFactory object that can represent many sizes of the font SourceHanCodeJP-Regular.otf
1107     */
1108    public static TextCellFactory getStretchableCodeJPFont()
1109    {
1110        initialize();
1111        if(instance.distanceCodeJP == null)
1112        {
1113            try {
1114                instance.distanceCodeJP = new TextCellFactory()
1115                        .fontDistanceField(distanceFieldCodeJP, distanceFieldCodeJPTexture).setSmoothingMultiplier(2.5f);
1116            } catch (Exception e) {
1117                e.printStackTrace();
1118            }
1119        }
1120        if(instance.distanceCodeJP != null)
1121            return instance.distanceCodeJP.copy();
1122        return null;
1123    }
1124    /**
1125     * Returns a TextCellFactory already configured to use a highly-legible fixed-width font with good Unicode support
1126     * and a thin, geometric style, that should scale cleanly to many sizes. Caches the result for later calls. The font
1127     * used is Iosevka, an open-source (SIL Open Font License) typeface by Belleve Invis (see
1128     * https://be5invis.github.io/Iosevka/ ), and it uses several customizations thanks to Iosevka's special build
1129     * process. It supports a lot of glyphs, including quite a bit of extended Latin, Greek, and Cyrillic, but also
1130     * circled letters and digits and the necessary box drawing characters. The high glyph count means the part of the
1131     * image for each glyph is smaller, though, so this may look slightly pixelated if it starts small and is resized to
1132     * much larger. A cell width of 11 and cell height of 20 is ideal (or some approximate multiple of that aspect
1133     * ratio); this allows the font to resize fairly well to larger sizes using Viewports. As an aside, Luc Devroye (a
1134     * true typography expert) called Iosevka <a href="http://luc.devroye.org/fonts-82704.html">"A tour de force that
1135     * deserves an award."</a> You may want to try using both this sans-serif version of Iosevka and the slab-serif
1136     * version SquidLib has, {@link #getStretchableSlabFont()}, though they have subtly different sizes. There are
1137     * also versions of Iosevka that use a Light weight, available by {@link #getStretchableLeanLightFont()} and
1138     * {@link #getStretchableSlabLightFont()}.
1139     * <br>
1140     * Preview: http://i.imgur.com/sm0ULbU.png
1141     * <br>
1142     * This creates a TextCellFactory instead of a BitmapFont because it needs to set some extra information so the
1143     * distance field font technique this uses can work.
1144     * <br>
1145     * Needs files:
1146     * <ul>
1147     *     <li>https://github.com/yellowstonegames/SquidLib/blob/master/assets/Iosevka-distance.fnt</li>
1148     *     <li>https://github.com/yellowstonegames/SquidLib/blob/master/assets/Iosevka-distance.png</li>
1149     * </ul>
1150     * @return the TextCellFactory object that can represent many sizes of the font Iosevka.ttf
1151     */
1152    public static TextCellFactory getStretchableLeanFont()
1153    {
1154        initialize();
1155        if(instance.distanceLean == null)
1156        {
1157            try {
1158                instance.distanceLean = new TextCellFactory()
1159                        .fontDistanceField(distanceFieldLean, distanceFieldLeanTexture).setSmoothingMultiplier(3.50f);
1160            } catch (Exception e) {
1161                e.printStackTrace();
1162            }
1163        }
1164        if(instance.distanceLean != null)
1165            return instance.distanceLean.copy();
1166        return null;
1167    }
1168
1169    /**
1170     * Returns a TextCellFactory already configured to use a highly-legible fixed-width font with good Unicode support
1171     * and a slab-serif geometric style, that should scale cleanly to many sizes. Caches the result for later calls. The
1172     * font used is Iosevka with Slab style, an open-source (SIL Open Font License) typeface by Belleve Invis (see
1173     * https://be5invis.github.io/Iosevka/ ), and it uses several customizations thanks to Iosevka's special build
1174     * process. It supports a lot of glyphs, including quite a bit of extended Latin, Greek, and Cyrillic, but also
1175     * circled letters and digits and the necessary box drawing characters. The high glyph count means the part of the
1176     * image for each glyph is smaller, though, so this may look slightly pixelated if it starts small and is resized to
1177     * much larger. A cell width of 11 and cell height of 20 is ideal (or some approximate multiple of that aspect
1178     * ratio); this allows the font to resize fairly well to larger sizes using Viewports. As an aside, Luc Devroye (a
1179     * true typography expert) called Iosevka <a href="http://luc.devroye.org/fonts-82704.html">"A tour de force that
1180     * deserves an award."</a> You may want to try using both this version of Iosevka with slab serifs and the other
1181     * version SquidLib has, {@link #getStretchableLeanFont()}, though they have subtly different sizes. There are
1182     * also versions of Iosevka that use a Light weight, available by {@link #getStretchableLeanLightFont()} and

1194     * </ul>

1223     * true typography expert) called Iosevka <a href="http://luc.devroye.org/fonts-82704.html">"A tour de force that
1224     * deserves an award."</a> You may want to try using both this sans-serif version of Iosevka and the slab-serif

1258    /**
1259     * Returns a TextCellFactory already configured to use a highly-legible fixed-width font with good Unicode support
1260     * and a very thin, slab-serif geometric style, that should scale cleanly to many sizes. Caches the result for later
1261     * calls. The font used is Iosevka with Slab style at Light weight, an open-source (SIL Open Font License) typeface
1262     * by Belleve Invis (see https://be5invis.github.io/Iosevka/ ), and it uses several customizations thanks to
1263     * Iosevka's special build process. It supports a lot of glyphs, including quite a bit of extended Latin, Greek, and
1264     * Cyrillic, but also circled letters and digits and the necessary box drawing characters. The high glyph count
1265     * means the part of the image for each glyph is smaller, though, so this may look slightly pixelated if it starts
1266     * small and is resized to much larger. A cell width of 11 and cell height of 20 is ideal (or some approximate
1267     * multiple of that aspect ratio); this allows the font to resize fairly well to larger sizes using Viewports. As an
1268     * aside, Luc Devroye (a true typography expert) called Iosevka <a href="http://luc.devroye.org/fonts-82704.html">"A
1269     * tour de force that deserves an award."</a> You may want to try using both this version of Iosevka with slab
1270     * serifs and the other version SquidLib has, {@link #getStretchableLeanLightFont()}, though they have subtly
1271     * different sizes. There are also versions of Iosevka that do not use this Light weight, available by
1272     * {@link #getStretchableLeanFont()} and {@link #getStretchableSlabFont()}.
1273     * <br>
1274     * Preview: http://i.imgur.com/B5eSGfj.png
1275     * <br>
1276     * This creates a TextCellFactory instead of a BitmapFont because it needs to set some extra information so the
1277     * distance field font technique this uses can work.
1278     * <br>
1279     * Needs files:
1280     * <ul>
1281     *     <li>https://github.com/yellowstonegames/SquidLib/blob/master/assets/Iosevka-Slab-Light-distance.fnt</li>
1282     *     <li>https://github.com/yellowstonegames/SquidLib/blob/master/assets/Iosevka-Slab-Light-distance.png</li>
1283     * </ul>
1284     * @return the TextCellFactory object that can represent many sizes of the font Iosevka-Slab-Light.ttf
1285     */
1286    public static TextCellFactory getStretchableSlabLightFont()
1287    {
1288        initialize();
1289        if(instance.distanceSlabLight == null)
1290        {
1291            try {
1292                instance.distanceSlabLight = new TextCellFactory()
1293                        .fontDistanceField(distanceFieldSlabLight, distanceFieldSlabLightTexture).setSmoothingMultiplier(2.50f);
1294            } catch (Exception e) {
1295                e.printStackTrace();
1296            }
1297        }
1298        if(instance.distanceSlabLight != null)
1299            return instance.distanceSlabLight.copy();
1300        return null;
1301    }

1303    /**
1304     * Returns a TextCellFactory already configured to use a font with extremely wide Unicode support that should scale
1305     * cleanly to many sizes. Caches the result for later calls. The font is DejaVu Sans Mono, a common font on Linux
1306     * operating systems and a clean-looking, legible font, though it has some visual quirks like a "tail" on lower-case
1307     * 'l', that take some getting used to. A possible requirement for this font is that the size of the text in a
1308     * SquidPanel or SquidLayers may need to be increased 1-5 pixels past what the cell width and height are; this can
1309     * be done with {@link SquidPanel#setTextSize(float, float)} or {@link SquidLayers#setTextSize(float, float)},
1310     * giving 1-2 more than the cell width for x and 3-5 more than the cell height for y.
1311     * <br>
1312     * Preview: http://i.imgur.com/1haETOe.png
1313     * <br>
1314     * This creates a TextCellFactory instead of a BitmapFont because it needs to set some extra information so the
1315     * distance field font technique this uses can work.
1316     * <br>
1317     * Needs files:
1318     * <ul>
1319     *     <li>https://github.com/yellowstonegames/SquidLib/blob/master/assets/DejaVuSansMono-distance.fnt</li>
1320     *     <li>https://github.com/yellowstonegames/SquidLib/blob/master/assets/DejaVuSansMono-distance.png</li>
1321     * </ul>
1322     * @return the TextCellFactory object that can represent many sizes of the font DejaVuSansMono.ttf
1323     */
1324    public static TextCellFactory getStretchableDejaVuFont()
1325    {
1326        initialize();
1327        if(instance.distanceDejaVu == null)
1328        {
1329            try {
1330                instance.distanceDejaVu = new TextCellFactory().fontDistanceField(distanceFieldDejaVu, distanceFieldDejaVuTexture).setSmoothingMultiplier(3.50f);
1331            } catch (Exception e) {
1332                e.printStackTrace();
1333            }
1334        }
1335        if(instance.distanceDejaVu != null)
1336            return instance.distanceDejaVu.copy();
1337        return null;
1338
1339    }

1343     * width displays like TextPanel. Caches the result for later calls.
1344     * <br>

1346     * <br>

1348     * distance field font technique this uses can work.
1349     * <br>

1351     * <ul>
1352     *     <li>https://github.com/yellowstonegames/SquidLib/blob/master/assets/Gentium-distance.fnt</li>

1354     * </ul>
1355     * @return the TextCellFactory object that can represent many sizes of the font Gentium, by SIL
1356     */
1357    public static TextCellFactory getStretchablePrintFont() {
1358        initialize();
1359        if (instance.distancePrint == null) {
1360            try {
1361                instance.distancePrint = new TextCellFactory().fontDistanceField(distanceFieldPrint, distanceFieldPrintTexture).setSmoothingMultiplier(2.50f)
1362                        .height(30).width(7);
1363                instance.distancePrint.bmpFont.setUseIntegerPositions(false);
1364                
1365            } catch (Exception e) {
1366                e.printStackTrace();
1367            }
1368        }
1369        if(instance.distancePrint != null)
1370            return instance.distancePrint.copy();
1371        return null;
1372    }

1409    /**

1413     * <br>
1414     * Note: Uses a smoothing multiplier of 0.8, instead of the default 1.2f. If you set the smoothing multiplier
1415     * yourself, it should be similarly smaller than what other fonts use (most fonts are 1.2, so multiplying whatever
1416     * you would normally set the smoothing multiplier to by 0.66f should work).
1417     * <br>
1418     * Preview: http://i.imgur.com/GF5qQxn.png
1419     * <br>
1420     * This creates a TextCellFactory instead of a BitmapFont because it needs to set some extra information so the
1421     * distance field font technique this uses can work.
1422     * <br>

1424     * <ul>
1425     *     <li>https://github.com/yellowstonegames/SquidLib/blob/master/assets/Noto-Sans-distance.fnt</li>
1426     *     <li>https://github.com/yellowstonegames/SquidLib/blob/master/assets/Noto-Sans-distance.png</li>
1427     * </ul>
1428     * @return the TextCellFactory object that can represent many sizes of the font Noto Sans, by Google
1429     */
1430    public static TextCellFactory getStretchableCleanFont() {
1431        initialize();
1432        if (instance.distanceClean == null) {
1433            try {
1434                instance.distanceClean = new TextCellFactory().fontDistanceField(distanceFieldClean, distanceFieldCleanTexture)
1435                        .setSmoothingMultiplier(2.50f).height(30).width(5);
1436                instance.distanceClean.bmpFont.setUseIntegerPositions(false);
1437            } catch (Exception e) {
1438                e.printStackTrace();
1439            }
1440        }
1441        if(instance.distanceClean != null)
1442            return instance.distanceClean.copy();
1443        return null;
1444    }

1446    /**
1447     * Returns a TextCellFactory already configured to use a highly-legible fixed-width font with good Unicode support
1448     * and a slab-serif geometric style, that should scale cleanly to even very large sizes (using an MSDF technique).
1449     * Caches the result for later calls. The font used is Iosevka with Slab style, an open-source (SIL Open Font
1450     * License) typeface by Belleve Invis (see https://be5invis.github.io/Iosevka/ ), and it uses several customizations
1451     * thanks to Iosevka's special build process. It supports a lot of glyphs, including quite a bit of extended Latin,
1452     * Greek, and Cyrillic, but also the necessary box drawing characters. This uses the Multi-channel Signed Distance
1453     * Field (MSDF) technique as opposed to the normal Signed Distance Field technique, which gives the rendered font
1454     * sharper edges and precise corners instead of rounded tips on strokes. As an aside, Luc Devroye (a true typography
1455     * expert) called Iosevka
1456     * <a href="http://luc.devroye.org/fonts-82704.html">"A tour de force that deserves an award."</a>
1457     * <br>
1458     * Preview: <a href="https://i.imgur.com/YlzFEVX.png">Image link</a>
1459     * <br>
1460     * This creates a TextCellFactory instead of a BitmapFont because it needs to set some extra information so the
1461     * multi-channel distance field font technique this uses can work.
1462     * <br>
1463     * Needs files:
1464     * <ul>
1465     *     <li>https://github.com/yellowstonegames/SquidLib/blob/master/assets/Iosevka-Slab-msdf.fnt</li>
1466     *     <li>https://github.com/yellowstonegames/SquidLib/blob/master/assets/Iosevka-Slab-msdf.png</li>
1467     * </ul>
1468     * @return the TextCellFactory object that can represent many sizes of the font Iosevka-Slab.ttf using MSDF
1469     */
1470    public static TextCellFactory getCrispSlabFont()
1471    {
1472        initialize();
1473        if(instance.msdfSlab == null)
1474        {
1475            try {
1476                instance.msdfSlab = new TextCellFactory()
1477                        .fontMultiDistanceField(crispSlab, crispSlabTexture).setSmoothingMultiplier(2.5f);
1478            } catch (Exception e) {
1479                e.printStackTrace();
1480            }
1481        }
1482        if(instance.msdfSlab != null)
1483            return instance.msdfSlab.copy();
1484        return null;
1485    }
1486    /**
1487     * Not supported; use {@link #getCrispSlabFamily()} instead, using {@link GDXMarkup} to add italics with its
1488     * {@code [/]} tag.
1489     * @return always throws an UnsupportedOperationException
1490     * @deprecated use {@link #getCrispSlabFamily()} instead
1491     */
1492    @Deprecated
1493    public static TextCellFactory getCrispSlabItalicFont()
1494    {
1495        throw new UnsupportedOperationException("Use getCrispSlabFamily() instead, with GDXMarkup to add italics.");
1496    }

1554     * including most extended Latin (though it doesn't support a handful of chars used by  FakeLanguageGen), Greek,
1555     * Braille, and Cyrillic, but also the necessary box drawing characters. This uses the Multi-channel Signed Distance
1556     * Field (MSDF) technique as opposed to the normal Signed Distance Field technique, which gives the rendered font
1557     * sharper edges and precise corners instead of rounded tips on strokes.
1558     * <br>
1559     *
1560     * <br>

1576        {
1577            try {
1578                instance.msdfCascadia = new TextCellFactory()
1579                        .fontMultiDistanceField(crispCascadia, crispCascadiaTexture).setSmoothingMultiplier(2f);

1588    /**
1589     * Returns a TextCellFactory already configured to use a fixed-width sans-serif font with excellent Unicode support,
1590     * that should scale cleanly to even very large sizes. Caches the result for later calls. The font used is DejaVu
1591     * Sans Mono, an open-source (SIL Open Font License) typeface that is widely used by Linux distros and other groups.
1592     * It supports a lot of glyphs, including quite a bit of extended Latin, Greek, and Cyrillic, but also the
1593     * necessary box drawing characters. This uses the Multi-channel Signed Distance Field technique as opposed to the
1594     * normal Signed Distance Field technique, which should allow sharper edges. It has been updated so it is laid out
1595     * mostly-correctly now; some glyphs may be a little wide, such as {@code @}, but the line height, baseline, and the
1596     * width for most glyphs seem correct. If you find the box drawing characters don't line up, try 
1597     * {@link TextCellFactory#tweakWidth(float)} with values like 1.125f; the exact value may depend on size.
1598     * <br>
1599     * Note: Uses a smoothing multiplier of 1f, instead of the default 1.2f. 
1600     * <br>
1601     * Preview: <a href="https://i.imgur.com/SCwhduv.png">Image link</a>
1602     * <br>
1603     * This creates a TextCellFactory instead of a BitmapFont because it needs to set some extra information so the
1604     * multi-channel distance field font technique this uses can work.
1605     * <br>
1606     * Needs files:
1607     * <ul>
1608     *     <li>https://github.com/yellowstonegames/SquidLib/blob/master/assets/DejaVuSansMono-msdf.fnt</li>
1609     *     <li>https://github.com/yellowstonegames/SquidLib/blob/master/assets/DejaVuSansMono-msdf.png</li>
1610     * </ul>
1611     * @return the TextCellFactory object that can represent many sizes of the font DejaVuSansMono.ttf with an MSDF effect
1612     */
1613    public static TextCellFactory getCrispDejaVuFont()
1614    {
1615        initialize();
1616        if(instance.msdfDejaVu == null)
1617        {
1618            try {
1619                instance.msdfDejaVu = new TextCellFactory()
1620                        .fontMultiDistanceField(crispDejaVu, crispDejaVuTexture).setSmoothingMultiplier(2.5f);
1621            } catch (Exception e) {
1622                e.printStackTrace();
1623            }
1624        }
1625        if(instance.msdfDejaVu != null)
1626            return instance.msdfDejaVu.copy();
1627        return null;
1628    }
1629    /**

1632     * Sans Mono. It supports a good range of Latin glyphs (not enough for Vietnamese, but enough for Western European
1633     * languages), as well as the Greek and Cyrillic alphabets, box drawing characters, and some dingbats. This uses the
1634     * Multi-channel Signed Distance Field technique as opposed to the normal Signed Distance Field technique, which
1635     * should allow sharper edges. Caches the result for later calls.
1636     * <br>

1641     * <ul>
1642     *     <li>https://github.com/yellowstonegames/SquidLib/blob/master/assets/Inconsolata-LGC-Custom-msdf.fnt</li>

1645     * </ul>
