1665    /**
1666     * Returns a TextFamily already configured to use a highly-legible fixed-width font with good Unicode support and a
1667     * slab-serif geometric style, that should scale cleanly to many sizes and supports 4 styles (regular, bold, italic,
1668     * and bold italic). Caches the result for later calls. The font used is Iosevka with Slab style, an open-source
1669     * (SIL Open Font License) typeface by Belleve Invis (see https://be5invis.github.io/Iosevka/ ), and it uses several
1670     * customizations thanks to Iosevka's special build process, applied to the 4 styles. It supports a lot of glyphs,
1671     * including quite a bit of extended Latin, Greek, and Cyrillic, but also circled letters and digits and the
1672     * necessary box drawing characters (which line up even for italic text). The high glyph count means the part of the
1673     * image for each glyph is smaller, though, so this may look slightly pixelated if it starts small and is resized to
1674     * much larger. A cell width of 11 and cell height of 20 is ideal (or some approximate multiple of that aspect
1675     * ratio); this allows the font to resize fairly well to larger sizes using Viewports. As an aside, Luc Devroye (a
1676     * true typography expert) called Iosevka <a href="http://luc.devroye.org/fonts-82704.html">"A tour de force that
1677     * deserves an award."</a> You may want to try using both this version of Iosevka with slab serifs and the other
1678     * version SquidLib has, {@link #getLeanFamily()}.
1679     * <br>
1680     * <br>
1681     * This creates a TextFamily instead of a BitmapFont because it needs to set some extra information so the
1682     * distance field font technique this uses can work, but it can also be used as a TextCellFactory.
1683     * <br>
1684     * Needs files:
1685     * <ul>
1686     *     <li>https://github.com/yellowstonegames/SquidLib/blob/master/assets/Iosevka-Slab-Family-distance.fnt</li>
1687     *     <li>https://github.com/yellowstonegames/SquidLib/blob/master/assets/Iosevka-Slab-Family-distance.png</li>
1688     * </ul>
1689     * @return the TextFamily object that can represent many sizes of the font Iosevka-Slab.ttf with 4 styles
1690     */
1691    public static TextFamily getSlabFamily()
1692    {
1693        initialize();
1694        if(instance.familySlab == null)
1695        {
1696            try {
1697                instance.familySlab = new TextFamily().defaultFamilySlabDistance();
1698            } catch (Exception e) {
1699                e.printStackTrace();
1700            }
1701        }
1702        if(instance.familySlab != null)
1703            return instance.familySlab.copy();
1704        return null;
1705    }
1706    /**
1707     * Returns a TextFamily already configured to use a highly-legible fixed-width font with good Unicode support and a
1708     * sans-serif geometric style, that should scale cleanly to many sizes and supports 4 styles (regular, bold, italic,
1709     * and bold italic). Caches the result for later calls. The font used is Iosevka, an open-source (SIL Open Font
1710     * License) typeface by Belleve Invis (see https://be5invis.github.io/Iosevka/ ), and it uses several customizations
1711     * thanks to Iosevka's special build process, applied to the 4 styles. It supports a lot of glyphs, including quite
1712     * a bit of extended Latin, Greek, and Cyrillic, but also circled letters and digits and the necessary box drawing
1713     * characters (which line up even for italic text). The high glyph count means the part of the image for each glyph
1714     * is smaller, though, so this may look slightly pixelated if it starts small and is resized to much larger. A cell
1715     * width of 11 and cell height of 20 is ideal (or some approximate multiple of that aspect ratio); this allows the
1716     * font to resize fairly well to larger sizes using Viewports. As an aside, Luc Devroye (a true typography expert)
1717     * called Iosevka <a href="http://luc.devroye.org/fonts-82704.html">"A tour de force that deserves an award."</a>
1718     * You may want to try using both this version of Iosevka without serifs and the other version SquidLib has,
1719     * {@link #getSlabFamily()}.
1720     * <br>
1721     * <br>
1722     * This creates a TextFamily instead of a BitmapFont because it needs to set some extra information so the
1723     * distance field font technique this uses can work, but it can also be used as a TextCellFactory.
1724     * <br>
1725     * Needs files:
1726     * <ul>
1727     *     <li>https://github.com/yellowstonegames/SquidLib/blob/master/assets/Iosevka-Family-distance.fnt</li>
1728     *     <li>https://github.com/yellowstonegames/SquidLib/blob/master/assets/Iosevka-Family-distance.png</li>
1729     * </ul>
1730     * @return the TextFamily object that can represent many sizes of the font Iosevka.ttf with 4 styles
1731     */
1732    public static TextFamily getLeanFamily()
1733    {
1734        initialize();
1735        if(instance.familyLean == null)
1736        {
1737            try {
1738                instance.familyLean = new TextFamily().defaultFamilyLeanDistance();
1739            } catch (Exception e) {
1740                e.printStackTrace();
1741            }
1742        }
1743        if(instance.familyLean != null)
1744            return instance.familyLean.copy();
1745        return null;
1746    }
1747    /**
1748     * Returns a TextFamily already configured to use a fixed-width font with good Unicode support and a traditional
1749     * serif style, that should scale cleanly to many sizes and supports 4 styles (regular, bold, italic,
1750     * and bold italic). Caches the result for later calls. The font used is Go Mono, a typeface released by the team
1751     * behind the Go programming language as open-source (3-clause BSD, the same license as the Go language; the license
1752     * is included with the assets). It supports a lot of glyphs, including quite a bit of extended Latin, Greek, and
1753     * Cyrillic, bu also the necessary box drawing characters (which line up even for italic text). There's more
1754     * information about this font available where it was introduced,
1755     * <a href="https://blog.golang.org/go-fonts">on the Go blog</a>.
1756     * You may want to try using this Go font family and contrasting it with Iosevka with and without slab serifs, which
1757     * are {@link #getSlabFamily()} and {@link #getLeanFamily()} respectively.
1758     * <br>
1759     * <br>
1760     * This creates a TextFamily instead of a BitmapFont because it needs to set some extra information so the
1761     * distance field font technique this uses can work, but it can also be used as a TextCellFactory.
1762     * <br>
1763     * Needs files:
1764     * <ul>
1765     *     <li>https://github.com/yellowstonegames/SquidLib/blob/master/assets/GoMono-Family-distance.fnt</li>
1766     *     <li>https://github.com/yellowstonegames/SquidLib/blob/master/assets/GoMono-Family-distance.png</li>
1767     *     <li>https://github.com/yellowstonegames/SquidLib/blob/master/assets/GoMono-License.txt</li>
1768     * </ul>
1769     * @return the TextFamily object that can represent many sizes of the font GoMono.ttf with 4 styles
1770     */
1771    public static TextFamily getGoFamily()
1772    {
1773        initialize();
1774        if(instance.familyGo == null)
1775        {
1776            try {
1777                instance.familyGo = new TextFamily();
1778                instance.familyGo.fontDistanceField("GoMono-Family-distance.fnt", "GoMono-Family-distance.png").setSmoothingMultiplier(4.00f);
1779            } catch (Exception e) {
1780                e.printStackTrace();
1781            }
1782        }
1783        if(instance.familyGo != null)
1784            return instance.familyGo.copy();
1785        return null;
1786    }
1787    /**
1788     * Returns a TextFamily already configured to use a highly-legible fixed-width font with good Unicode support and a
1789     * sans-serif geometric style, that should scale cleanly to many sizes (using an MSDF technique) and supports 4
1790     * styles (regular, bold, italic, and bold italic). Caches the result for later calls. The font used is Iosevka, an
1791     * open-source (SIL Open Font License) typeface by Belleve Invis (see https://be5invis.github.io/Iosevka/ ), and it 
1792     * uses several customizations thanks to Iosevka's special build process, applied to the 4 styles. It supports a lot
1793     * of glyphs, including quite a bit of extended Latin, Greek, and Cyrillic, but also circled letters and digits and
1794     * the necessary box drawing characters (which line up even for italic text). The high glyph count means the texture
1795     * that holds all four faces of the font is larger than normal, at 4096x4096; this may be too large for some devices
1796     * to load correctly (mostly older phones or tablets). A cell width of 11 and cell height of 20 is ideal (or some
1797     * approximate multiple of that aspect ratio); this allows the font to resize fairly well to larger sizes using
1798     * Viewports.  This uses the Multi-channel Signed Distance Field (MSDF) technique as opposed to the normal Signed
1799     * Distance Field technique, which gives the rendered font sharper edges and precise corners instead of rounded tips
1800     * on strokes. As an aside, Luc Devroye (a true typography expert) called Iosevka
1801     * <a href="http://luc.devroye.org/fonts-82704.html">"A tour de force that deserves an award."</a> You may want to
1802     * try using both this version of Iosevka without serifs and the other version SquidLib has with an MSDF effect, 
1803     * {@link #getCrispSlabFamily()}.
1804     * <br>
1805     * Preview: <a href="https://i.imgur.com/dMVzpEi.png">image link</a>, with bold at the bottom.
1806     * <br>
1807     * This creates a TextFamily instead of a BitmapFont because it needs to set some extra information so the
1808     * distance field font technique this uses can work, but it can also be used as a TextCellFactory.
1809     * <br>
1810     * Needs files:
1811     * <ul>
1812     *     <li>https://github.com/yellowstonegames/SquidLib/blob/master/assets/Iosevka-Family-msdf.fnt</li>
1813     *     <li>https://github.com/yellowstonegames/SquidLib/blob/master/assets/Iosevka-Family-msdf.png</li>
1814     * </ul>
1815     * @return the TextFamily object that can represent many sizes of the font Iosevka.ttf with 4 styles and an MSDF effect
1816     */
1817    public static TextFamily getCrispLeanFamily()
1818    {
1819        initialize();
1820        if(instance.familyLeanMSDF == null)
1821        {
1822            try {
1823                instance.familyLeanMSDF = new TextFamily();
1824                instance.familyLeanMSDF.fontMultiDistanceField("Iosevka-Family-msdf.fnt", "Iosevka-Family-msdf.png");
1825            } catch (Exception e) {
1826                e.printStackTrace();
1827            }
1828        }
1829        if(instance.familyLeanMSDF != null)
1830            return instance.familyLeanMSDF.copy();
1831        return null;
1832
1833    }
1834
1835    /**
1836     * Returns a TextFamily already configured to use a highly-legible fixed-width font with good Unicode support and a
1837     * slab-serif geometric style, that should scale cleanly to many sizes (using an MSDF technique) and supports 4
1838     * styles (regular, bold, italic, and bold italic). Caches the result for later calls. The font used is Iosevka with
1839     * slab style, an open-source (SIL Open Font License) typeface by Belleve Invis (see
1840     * https://be5invis.github.io/Iosevka/ ), and it uses several customizations thanks to Iosevka's special build
1841     * process, applied to the 4 styles. It supports a lot of glyphs, including quite a bit of extended Latin, Greek,
1842     * and Cyrillic, but also circled letters and digits and the necessary box drawing characters (which line up even 
1843     * for italic text). The high glyph count means the texture that holds all four faces of the font is larger than
1844     * normal, at 4096x4096; this may be too large for some devices to load correctly (mostly older phones or tablets).
1845     * A cell width of 11 and cell height of 20 is ideal (or some approximate multiple of that aspect ratio); this
1846     * allows the font to resize fairly well to larger sizes using Viewports.  This uses the Multi-channel Signed
1847     * Distance Field (MSDF) technique as opposed to the normal Signed  Distance Field technique, which gives the
1848     * rendered font sharper edges and precise corners instead of rounded tips on strokes. As an aside, Luc Devroye (a
1849     * true typography expert) called Iosevka <a href="http://luc.devroye.org/fonts-82704.html">"A tour de force that
1850     * deserves an award."</a> You may want to try using both this version of Iosevka with slab serifs and the other
1851     * version SquidLib has with an MSDF effect, {@link #getCrispLeanFamily()}.
1852     * <br>
1853     * Note: Uses a smoothing multiplier of 1.55f, instead of the default 1.2f. 
1854     * <br>
1855     * Preview: <a href="https://i.imgur.com/wRNlpL5.png">image link</a>, with bold at the bottom.
1856     * <br>
1857     * This creates a TextFamily instead of a BitmapFont because it needs to set some extra information so the
1858     * distance field font technique this uses can work, but it can also be used as a TextCellFactory.
1859     * <br>
1860     * Needs files:
1861     * <ul>
1862     *     <li>https://github.com/yellowstonegames/SquidLib/blob/master/assets/Iosevka-Slab-Family-msdf.fnt</li>
1863     *     <li>https://github.com/yellowstonegames/SquidLib/blob/master/assets/Iosevka-Slab-Family-msdf.png</li>
1864     * </ul>
1865     * @return the TextFamily object that can represent many sizes of the font Iosevka-Slab.ttf with 4 styles and an MSDF effect
1866     */
1867    public static TextFamily getCrispSlabFamily()
1868    {
1869        initialize();
1870        if(instance.familySlabMSDF == null)
1871        {
1872            try {
1873                instance.familySlabMSDF = new TextFamily();
1874                instance.familySlabMSDF
1875                        .fontMultiDistanceField("Iosevka-Slab-Family-msdf.fnt", "Iosevka-Slab-Family-msdf.png")
1876                        .setSmoothingMultiplier(1.55f);
1877            } catch (Exception e) {
1878                e.printStackTrace();
1879            }
1880        }
1881        if(instance.familySlabMSDF != null)
1882            return instance.familySlabMSDF.copy();
1883        return null;
1884
1885    }
1886    /**
1887     * Returns a TextFamily already configured to use a variable-width serif font that should look like the serif
1888     * fonts used in many novels' main texts, and that should scale cleanly to many sizes using an MSDF technique, and
1889     * supports 4 styles (regular, bold, italic, and bold italic). Caches the result for later calls. The font used is 
1890     * Noto Serif, which is OFL-licensed by Google, and looks very legible in normal use. Meant to be used in
1891     * variable-width displays like TextPanel.
1892     * <br>
1893     * Note: Uses a smoothing multiplier of 1.5f, instead of the default 1.2f. 
1894     * <br>
1895     * Preview: <a href="https://i.imgur.com/WsDqSfJ.png">In the foreground message box in ZoneDemo</a>
1896     * <br>
1897     * This creates a TextFamily instead of a BitmapFont because it needs to set some extra information so the
1898     * distance field font technique this uses can work, but it can also be used as a TextCellFactory.
1899     * <br>
1900     * Needs files:
1901     * <ul>
1902     *     <li>https://github.com/yellowstonegames/SquidLib/blob/master/assets/NotoSerif-Family-msdf.fnt</li>
1903     *     <li>https://github.com/yellowstonegames/SquidLib/blob/master/assets/NotoSerif-Family-msdf.png</li>
1904     *     <li>https://github.com/yellowstonegames/SquidLib/blob/master/assets/NotoSerif-license.txt</li>
1905     * </ul>
1906     * @return the TextCellFactory object that can represent many sizes of the font Noto Serif, made available by Google
1907     */
1908    public static TextFamily getCrispPrintFamily() {
1909        initialize();
1910        if (instance.familyPrintMSDF == null) {
1911            try {
1912                instance.familyPrintMSDF = new TextFamily();
1913                instance.familyPrintMSDF.fontMultiDistanceField(crispNotoSerif, crispNotoSerifTexture)
1914                        .width(7).height(30).setSmoothingMultiplier(1.5f);
1915                instance.familyPrintMSDF.font().setUseIntegerPositions(false);
1916            } catch (Exception e) {
1917                e.printStackTrace();
1918            }
1919        }
1920        if(instance.familyPrintMSDF != null)
1921            return instance.familyPrintMSDF.copy();
1922        return null;
1923    }
1924    /**
1925     * Returns a TextCellFactory already configured to use a partially-angular variable-width font with good Unicode
1926     * support and an appearance as if it were carved into solid rock, that should scale cleanly to even very large
1927     * sizes (using an MSDF technique). Caches the result for later calls. The font used is
1928     * <a href="https://fontstruct.com/fontstructions/show/507930/bloccus">Bloccus by Christian Munk</a>. It supports a
1929     * lot of glyphs, including most of extended Latin, Greek, Cyrillic, and the International Phonetic Alphabet (IPA),
1930     * but not box drawing characters because this is variable-width. This uses the Multi-channel Signed Distance
1931     * Field (MSDF) technique as opposed to the normal Signed Distance Field technique, which gives the rendered font
1932     * sharper edges and precise corners instead of rounded tips on strokes.
1933     * <br>
1934     * Note: Uses a smoothing multiplier of 1f, instead of the default 1.2f. 
1935     * <br>
1936     * Preview: <a href="https://i.imgur.com/zaqgHTW.png">Image link</a>
1937     * <br>
1938     * This creates a TextCellFactory instead of a BitmapFont because it needs to set some extra information so the
1939     * multi-channel distance field font technique this uses can work.
1940     * <br>
1941     * Needs files:
1942     * <ul>
1943     *     <li>https://github.com/yellowstonegames/SquidLib/blob/master/assets/bloccus-msdf.fnt</li>
1944     *     <li>https://github.com/yellowstonegames/SquidLib/blob/master/assets/bloccus-msdf.png</li>
1945     *     <li>https://github.com/yellowstonegames/SquidLib/blob/master/assets/bloccus-license.txt</li>
1946     * </ul>
1947     * @return the TextCellFactory object that can represent many sizes of the font bloccus.ttf
1948     */
1949    public static TextCellFactory getCrispCarvedFont()
1950    {
1951        initialize();
1952        if(instance.msdfCarved == null)
1953        {
1954            try {
1955                instance.msdfCarved = new TextCellFactory()
1956                        .fontMultiDistanceField(crispCarved, crispCarvedTexture)
1957                        .width(7f).height(24f).setSmoothingMultiplier(1.0f);
1958            } catch (Exception e) {
1959                e.printStackTrace();
1960            }
1961        }
1962        if(instance.msdfCarved != null)
1963            return instance.msdfCarved.copy();
1964        return null;
1965    }
1966    /**
1967     * Returns a TextCellFactory already configured to use a variable-width sans-serif font with good Unicode support
1968     * and a no-nonsense look, that should scale cleanly to even very large or small sizes (using an MSDF technique).
1969     * Caches the result for later calls. The font used is <a href="https://fonts.google.com/specimen/Roboto">Roboto
1970     * Regular by Christian Robertson</a>. It supports a lot of glyphs, including most Latin, Greek, and Cyrillic,
1971     * but not box drawing characters because this is variable-width. This uses the Multi-channel Signed Distance
1972     * Field (MSDF) technique as opposed to the normal Signed Distance Field technique, which gives the rendered font
1973     * sharper edges and precise corners instead of rounded tips on strokes.
1974     * <br>
1975     * Note: Uses a smoothing multiplier of 2f, instead of the default 1.2f. 
1976     * <br>
1977     * Preview: <a href="https://i.imgur.com/ASjdjc6.png">Image link when scaled to a small size</a>
1978     * <br>
1979     * This creates a TextCellFactory instead of a BitmapFont because it needs to set some extra information so the
1980     * multi-channel distance field font technique this uses can work.
1981     * <br>
1982     * Needs files:
1983     * <ul>
1984     *     <li>https://github.com/yellowstonegames/SquidLib/blob/master/assets/Roboto-Regular-msdf.fnt</li>
1985     *     <li>https://github.com/yellowstonegames/SquidLib/blob/master/assets/Roboto-Regular-msdf.png</li>
1986     *     <li>https://github.com/yellowstonegames/SquidLib/blob/master/assets/Roboto-License.txt</li>
1987     * </ul>
1988     * @return the TextCellFactory object that can represent many sizes of the font Roboto-Regular.ttf
1989     */
1990    public static TextCellFactory getCrispRobotoSansFont()
1991    {
1992        initialize();
1993        if(instance.msdfRoboto == null)
1994        {
1995            try {
1996                instance.msdfRoboto = new TextCellFactory()
1997                        .fontMultiDistanceField(crispRobotoSans, crispRobotoSansTexture)
1998                        .width(3f).height(14f).setSmoothingMultiplier(2f);
1999            } catch (Exception e) {
2000                e.printStackTrace();
2001            }
2002        }
2003        if(instance.msdfRoboto != null)
2004            return instance.msdfRoboto.copy();
2005        return null;
2006    }

2008    /**
2009     * Returns a TextCellFactory already configured to use a fixed-width icon font (no letters are supported) using the
2010     * Font-Awesome icon set, that should scale cleanly to even very large sizes. Caches the result for later calls.
2011     * The icon font used is the popular Font-Awesome free set (solid style), an open-source (SIL Open Font License)
2012     * typeface that is often used online. You will probably want to consult the cheatsheet for what chars are actually
2013     * supported; <a href="https://fontawesome.com/cheatsheet">the cheatsheet is here</a>. This uses the Multi-channel
2014     * Signed Distance Field technique as opposed to the normal Signed Distance Field technique, which should allow
2015     * sharper edges. You may also want the list of all chars in this icon font; {@link #iconFontAll} has that.
2016     * <br>
2017     * Preview: <a href="">Image link</a>
2018     * <br>
2019     * This creates a TextCellFactory instead of a BitmapFont because it needs to set some extra information so the
2020     * multi-channel distance field font technique this uses can work.
2021     * <br>
2022     * Needs files:
2023     * <ul>
2024     *     <li>https://github.com/yellowstonegames/SquidLib/blob/master/assets/awesome-solid-msdf.fnt</li>
2025     *     <li>https://github.com/yellowstonegames/SquidLib/blob/master/assets/awesome-solid-msdf.png</li>
2026     *     <li>https://github.com/yellowstonegames/SquidLib/blob/master/assets/Font-Awesome-license.txt</li>
2027     * </ul>
2028     * @return the TextCellFactory object that can represent many sizes of Font Awesome Free (solid) with an MSDF effect
2029     */
2030    public static TextCellFactory getCrispIconFont()
2031    {
2032        initialize();
2033        if(instance.msdfIcons == null)
2034        {
2035            try {
2036                instance.msdfIcons = new TextCellFactory()
2037                        .fontMultiDistanceField(crispIcons, crispIconsTexture);
2038            } catch (Exception e) {
2039                e.printStackTrace();
2040            }
2041        }
2042        if(instance.msdfIcons != null)
2043            return instance.msdfIcons.copy();
2044        return null;
2045
2046    }

2050    /**
2051     * Gets an image of a (squid-like, for SquidLib) tentacle, 32x32px.
2052     * Source is public domain: http://opengameart.org/content/496-pixel-art-icons-for-medievalfantasy-rpg
2053     * Created by Henrique Lazarini (7Soul1, http://7soul1.deviantart.com/ )
2054     * <br>
2055     * Needs file:
2056     * <ul>
2057     *     <li>https://github.com/yellowstonegames/SquidLib/blob/master/assets/Tentacle.png</li>
2058     * </ul>
2059     * @return a TextureRegion containing an image of a tentacle.
2060     */
2061    public static TextureRegion getTentacle()
2062    {
2063        initialize();
2064        if(instance.tentacle == null || instance.tentacleRegion == null)
2065        {
2066            try {
2067                instance.tentacle = new Texture(Gdx.files.internal("Tentacle.png"));
2068                instance.tentacleRegion = new TextureRegion(instance.tentacle);
2069            } catch (Exception ignored) {
2070            }
2071        }
2072        return instance.tentacleRegion;
2073    }

2076    /**
2077     * Gets a TextureAtlas containing many icons with a distance field effect applied, allowing them to be used with
2078     * "stretchable" fonts and be resized in the same way. These will not look as-expected if stretchable fonts are not
2079     * in use, and will seem hazy and indistinct if the shader hasn't been set up for a distance field effect by
2080     * TextCellFactory (which stretchable fonts will do automatically). The one page of the TextureAtlas is 2048x2048,
2081     * which may be too large for some old, low-end Android phones, and possibly integrated graphics with fairly old
2082     * processors on desktop. It has over 2000 icons.
2083     * <br>
2084     * The icons are CC-BY and the license is distributed with them, though the icons are not necessarily included with
2085     * SquidLib. If you use the icon atlas, be sure to include icons-license.txt with it and reference it with your
2086     * game's license and/or credits information.
2087     * <br>
2088     * Needs files:
2089     * <ul>
2090     *     <li>https://github.com/yellowstonegames/SquidLib/blob/master/assets/icons.atlas</li>
2091     *     <li>https://github.com/yellowstonegames/SquidLib/blob/master/assets/icons.png</li>
2092     *     <li>https://github.com/yellowstonegames/SquidLib/blob/master/assets/icons-license.txt Needed to credit artists</li>
2093     * </ul>
2094     * @return a TextureAtlas containing over 2000 icons with a distance field effect
2095     */
2096    public static TextureAtlas getIconAtlas()
2097    {
2098        initialize();
2099        if(instance.iconAtlas == null)
2100        {
2101            try {
2102                instance.iconAtlas = new TextureAtlas(Gdx.files.internal("icons.atlas"));
2103            } catch (Exception ignored) {
2104            }
2105        }
2106        return instance.iconAtlas;
2107    }

2109    /**
2110     * This is a static global StatefulRNG that's meant for usage in cases where the seed does not matter and any
2111     * changes to this RNG's state will not change behavior elsewhere in the program; this means the GUI mainly.
2112     */
2113    public static StatefulRNG getGuiRandom()
2114    {
2115        initialize();
2116        if(instance.guiRandom == null)
2117        {
2118            instance.guiRandom =  new StatefulRNG();
2119        }
2120        return instance.guiRandom;
2121    }
2122    /**
2123     * This is a static global SquidColorCenter that can be used in places that just need an existing object that can do
2124     * things like analyze hue or saturation of a color.
2125     */
2126    public static SquidColorCenter getSCC()
2127    {
2128        initialize();
2129        if(instance.scc == null)
2130        {
2131            instance.scc =  new SquidColorCenter();
2132        }
2133        return instance.scc;
2134    }

2139    public static final String narrowFontSymbols = "";

2152                                          "\n" +

2163    /**
2164     * All of the Font-Awesome Free (solid style) characters in {@link #getCrispIconFont()}, as a String.
